co.paralleluniverse.data.record

Interface RecordArray<R>

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Iterable<Record<R>>

    public interface RecordArray<R>
extends Iterable<Record<R>>
    Represents an array of Records. This interface allows for efficient (packed) storage of the records.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  RecordArray.Accessor
      An opaque pointer to an element in a RecordArray.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Record<R> at(int index)
      Returns the record element at the given index, using the given accessor.
      Record<R> at(RecordArray.Accessor accessor, int index)
      Returns the record element at the given index, using the given accessor.
      RecordArray.Accessor newAccessor()
      Allocates a new accessor into this array.
      RecordArray.Accessor reset(RecordArray.Accessor accessor)
      Resets the position of the given accessor so that it no longer points to any element.
      RecordArray<R> slice(int from, int to)
      Returns a RecordArray slice of this array.
      RecordType<R> type()
      The elements' type.

      • Methods inherited from interface java.lang.Iterable

        iterator

    • Method Detail

      • type

        RecordType<R> type()
        The elements' type.

      • newAccessor

        RecordArray.Accessor newAccessor()
        Allocates a new accessor into this array.
        Returns:
        a new accessor into this array.

      • reset

        RecordArray.Accessor reset(RecordArray.Accessor accessor)
        Resets the position of the given accessor so that it no longer points to any element.
        Parameters:
        accessor - the accessor
        Returns:
        the accessor

      • at

        Record<R> at(RecordArray.Accessor accessor,
           int index)
        Returns the record element at the given index, using the given accessor.

        The returned record is tied to the accessor, so it can only be used until the accessor is reset or set to a different element.

        Parameters:
        index - the element's index
        Returns:
        the record element at the given index

      • at

        Record<R> at(int index)
        Returns the record element at the given index, using the given accessor. Same as at(newAccessor(), index).
        Parameters:
        index - the element's index
        Returns:
        the record element at the given index

      • slice

        RecordArray<R> slice(int from,
                   int to)
        Returns a RecordArray slice of this array. The elements are not copied, and changes to the slice are reflected in this array and vice versa.
        Parameters:
        from - the first element index of this array to include in the slice, inclusive
        to - the last element index of this array to include in the slice, exclusive (the element at this index is not included in the slice.
        Returns:
        a slice of this array
